intro: Euploca chrysocarpa, commonly known as the golden-fruited euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and contain seeds. Euploca chrysocarpa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and an important component of its natural habitat.
